title: Advice to Give Women Blood Thinners After C-Sections Draws Fire
text:
Doctors are criticizing a recent recommendation from medical experts to give blood-thinning drugs to nearly all women who give birth by caesarean section, saying the advice may be unsafe and tainted by potential conflicts of interest.

Hospitals across the U.S. have been adopting the recommendation—aimed at preventing fatal blood clots—since it was published in the medical journal Obstetrics & Gynecology in 2016. But many doctors say there isn’t any evidence to support such widespread blood thinner use and it could harm...
